rukus.text: By the star when it goes down
Your Companion (the Messenger) has neither gone astray nor adopted a wrong way (in belief and action)
He does not speak on his own, out of his own desire
That (which he conveys to you) is but a Revelation that is revealed to him
One of forceful might (Gabriel) has taught it
One firm, with ability to penetrate and perfect in spirit, rose with all his splendor
When he was in the highest part of the horizon
Then, he drew near and came close
So he was (so near that there was left only the distance between) the strings of two bows (put adjacent to each other) or even nearer (than that)
And He revealed to His servant what He revealed
The heart did not contradict what he saw (with his eyes)
Will you then dispute with him concerning what he saw
Assuredly he saw him during a second descent
By the Lote-tree of the utmost boundary
Near it is the Garden of Refuge and Dwelling
Meanwhile that was covering the Lote-tree which was covering it
The sight (of the Messenger) did not swerve (so that he looked elsewhere and saw something different), nor did it go wrong (so that he might have seen an illusion)
Indeed, he saw one among the greatest signs of His Lord
(As compared to that) have you considered al-Lat and al-â€˜Uzza
And the other, the third (idol), al-Manat: (what things are these that you concoct)
What? For you the males and for Him the females
That is an unfair division indeed

They (your false deities) are nothing but made-up names that you and your forefathers have invented; God sent no authority for them. They follow only conjecture and that which they themselves lust after. But now there has certainly come to them guidance from their Lord (Who has created them, and sustains them)
Or will human attain whatever he craves
But (whatever human desires, be it to serve his higher good, or to serve his carnal appetites) to God belong the after(life) and the former (life)
